hero.title: The Video Layer of the Social Web
hero.subline: A mock diligence report exploring whether early user-generated video could become a default habit product.

dealMemoCards.title: Problem
dealMemoCards.heading: Online video is still awkward and fragmented
dealMemoCards.body: Users can discover clips, but uploading and sharing remains technical, slow, and scattered across niche sites with weak identity loops.

dealMemoCards.title: Solution
dealMemoCards.heading: Upload in minutes, share everywhere
dealMemoCards.body: The product removes encoding complexity, gives each video a simple URL, and encourages remix-friendly distribution through embeds and links.

dealMemoCards.title: Business Model
dealMemoCards.heading: Engagement first, monetization staged
dealMemoCards.body: Near-term focus is growth quality and creator supply; mid-term options include brand ads, promoted channels, and tools for commercial creators.

dealMemoCards.title: Stage
dealMemoCards.heading: Early traction with unclear legal ceiling
dealMemoCards.body: The usage curve is promising but policy tooling and copyright workflows must scale faster than content velocity to avoid a hard stop.

team.name: Ari Nolan
team.bio: Consumer instinct with strong shipping cadence; obsessed with making creator workflows frictionless.

team.name: Mina Patel
team.bio: Built distributed media tooling before; focused on keeping reliability ahead of usage spikes.

team.name: Leo Kim
team.bio: Runs creator onboarding and moderation ops, balancing growth with trust from day one.

competition.body: Incumbents can replicate interface features quickly, but they are slower to nurture creator-native behavior. The current race is less about raw hosting capacity and more about becoming the default place users publish first and viewers check daily.

debateTriggers.title: Copyright risk velocity
debateTriggers.detail: Does rights-claim volume outpace takedown throughput by Q4 next year?

debateTriggers.title: Creator retention quality
debateTriggers.detail: Are upload cohorts stabilizing after novelty traffic fades?

debateTriggers.title: Infrastructure cost curve
debateTriggers.detail: Can cost per streamed minute decline fast enough as watch-time expands?

debateTriggers.title: Distribution concentration
debateTriggers.detail: How dependent is growth on external embeds vs destination behavior?

debateTriggers.title: Brand safety readiness
debateTriggers.detail: Can ad inventory be packaged without harming the open-upload identity?

debateTriggers.title: Founder bandwidth
debateTriggers.detail: Is leadership depth sufficient to run product, legal, and hiring simultaneously?

debateTriggers.title: Incumbent reaction window
debateTriggers.detail: How long before major portals deploy credible clones to existing audiences?

spotlight.label: The Bull
spotlight.name: Nora Adesina
spotlight.rationale: Pattern-matched category-defining habit loops in prior consumer bets and sees the share-upload loop compounding quickly.

spotlight.label: The Bear
spotlight.name: Victor Han
spotlight.rationale: Strong on legal downside; worries unresolved rights workflows could cap valuation despite growth.

spotlight.label: Wild Card
spotlight.name: Samir Rao
spotlight.rationale: Believes community tools could unlock defensibility if shipped before incumbent feature parity arrives.

evaluations.name: Mara (Consumer Partner)
strengths: Creator motivation appears intrinsic, not purely financial
concerns: Daily active ratio still volatile by geography
Needs clearer plan for non-viral discovery
evaluations.quote: If this becomes where people post first, distribution alone can outpace better-funded competitors.

evaluations.name: Jon (Infra Specialist)
concerns: Storage assumptions may be too optimistic
No clear failover narrative for major spikes
evaluations.quote: The product can win demand, but infrastructure must keep trust from cracking under its own growth.

evaluations.name: Elise (Risk Partner)
strengths: Early moderation protocols are directionally right
concerns: Limited precedent for current rights approach
Escalation paths are understaffed
evaluations.quote: Without legal throughput, growth can convert from advantage to liability in a single cycle.

evaluations.name: David (Monetization)
strengths: High session depth suggests future ad inventory
concerns: Safety controls lag revenue ambitions
Direct sales motion not yet designed
evaluations.quote: Monetization will come, but only if trust-and-safety maturity arrives first.

evaluations.name: Priya (Go-to-Market)
concerns: Partnerships still ad hoc
Search discoverability relies on immature metadata
evaluations.quote: They are quietly becoming infrastructure for internet sharing behavior.

evaluations.name: Kenji (Operating Partner)
concerns: Middle-management layer missing
Process debt accumulating in incident response
evaluations.quote: I trust this team to ship their way out of early chaos if board support is active.

evaluations.name: Lina (Fintech Crossover)
concerns: No convincing path to near-term gross margin
Compute exposure could dominate planning
evaluations.quote: Great product signals do not erase bad economics; we need evidence, not optimism.

evaluations.name: Owen (Growth Scientist)
strengths: Uploader cohorts show improving repeat rates
concerns: Segment-level churn analysis incomplete
North-star metric debate unresolved
evaluations.quote: The growth data is promising, but not yet complete enough for blind confidence.

evaluations.name: Sara (Policy Advisor)
strengths: Leadership accepts policy as core function
concerns: Tooling depth still basic
Global policy posture undefined
evaluations.quote: I would rather back a team that knows policy is hard than one pretending it isn't.

evaluations.name: Noah (General Partner)
concerns: Governance terms must include tighter reporting
Follow-on capital needs may arrive earlier
evaluations.quote: This is exactly the kind of volatile but category-scale bet the fund is built to take.

debateRounds.summary: The committee opens by separating short-term novelty from durable behavior.

turns.speaker: Mara
turns.text: Viewer return cadence is tightening, suggesting routine rather than occasional curiosity.

turns.speaker: Lina
turns.text: We still need segment data to know if heavy users are masking weak cohorts.

turns.speaker: Owen
turns.text: Early cohort cuts support retention, but not enough to dismiss concentration risk.

callouts: Ask for cohort retention by upload frequency

debateRounds.summary: Focus shifts to whether legal obligations can be operationalized at scale.

turns.speaker: Elise
turns.text: Current policy process is well intentioned but underpowered for a volume spike.

turns.speaker: Sara
turns.text: The team is coachable; we can help staff policy and improve escalation pathways.

callouts: Tie funding to policy hiring milestones

debateRounds.summary: Debate on whether creator behavior can become a moat before incumbents replicate features.

turns.speaker: Priya
turns.text: Embeds create distribution gravity that copycat products may struggle to recreate quickly.

turns.speaker: Victor
turns.text: Large portals can bundle video into existing traffic channels overnight.

turns.speaker: Kenji
turns.text: Execution speed plus creator goodwill can buy a meaningful lead window.

debateRounds.summary: The room pressure-tests growth against gross margin realities.

turns.speaker: Jon
turns.text: Efficiency gains are possible, but we need a transparent cost-per-minute path.

turns.speaker: David
turns.text: Revenue timing should follow trust improvements to avoid damaging user trust.

debateRounds.summary: Final vote balances conviction with risk-control terms.

turns.speaker: Noah
turns.text: We should invest with governance guardrails instead of waiting for certainty.

turns.speaker: Lina
turns.text: I can support only if reporting rights are explicit and frequent.

turns.speaker: Mara
turns.text: The upside justifies measured risk if execution support is hands-on.

callouts: Attach board-level legal and infra checkpoints

insights.title: People Form the Product Moat
insights.body: Creator identity and repeat sharing behaviors are currently more defensible than any technical feature set.

insights.title: Policy Throughput Is a Core KPI
insights.body: Legal responsiveness should be tracked with the same discipline as growth and retention metrics.

insights.title: Monetization Must Follow Trust
insights.body: Revenue rollout should be phased behind safeguards to protect brand confidence and creator incentives.

insights.title: Infra Planning Cannot Be Deferred
insights.body: Scaling costs will determine strategic flexibility; instrumentation is required now, not post-Series A.

insights.title: Execution Tempo Is an Asset
insights.body: The team’s shipping velocity is a key edge, provided hiring keeps pace with operational complexity.

insights.title: Governance Should Be Active
insights.body: Board involvement is a practical lever for reducing downside while preserving speed.

questions: Which creator cohorts sustain uploads after week eight?
What is the strongest signal of destination intent vs incidental viewing?
Where does sharing break today for high-frequency users?
How will rights claims be triaged as volume scales 10x?
What legal response SLA can the team commit to this year?
Which policy hires are mission-critical pre-next round?
What drives cost-per-minute variance across user segments?
Where are current reliability bottlenecks under peak traffic?
What redundancy plan exists for major regional outages?

actions: Stand up weekly operating review with growth, policy, and infra metrics.
Create incident playbook with escalation owners and response windows.
Instrument creator funnel from signup to third upload.
Run discovery experiments to reduce dependence on viral spikes.
Define destination behavior KPI and monitor monthly.
Set guardrails for burn multiple tied to milestone achievement.
Prepare financing strategy for accelerated infrastructure spend.

execSummary: This mock IC process recommends a conditional invest: demand signals are unusually strong for the stage, and creator behavior suggests the possibility of a durable category position.

The primary threat is not competition alone, but operational fragility across policy and infrastructure. With explicit governance rights and milestone-based support, the upside remains compelling relative to entry price.

epilogueMetric.detail: Illustrative five-year equity value in our base case if destination behavior compounds and policy execution remains ahead of growth.
